summary: This document appears to be an FBI interview summary (302) with Juan Alessi, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein. Alessi describes his duties, interactions with Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and various young women, including details about transportation, household rules, and the change in Epstein's behavior after Maxwell's arrival.

persons.name: Juan Alessi
persons.context: Former employee of Jeffrey Epstein who drove for him, picked up girls, and managed household tasks. He describes the household operations and his observations.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the investigation. Alessi describes his behavior, interactions with young girls, and changes in his demeanor after Ghislaine Maxwell arrived.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as arriving after Eva Andersson and changing the household dynamics, bringing younger girls into the picture. She gave Alessi orders.

persons.name: Eva Andersson
persons.context: Described as being pleasant and present before Ghislaine Maxwell arrived. She remained friends with Epstein after leaving.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned as a guest whom Alessi would drive from the airport along with girls.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the many different people seen at Epstein's home.

persons.name: Robert Kennedy
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the many different people seen at Epstein's home.

persons.name: Ruby
persons.context: A British individual who was around all the time and was friends with Maxwell and Epstein.

connections.description: Alessi was employed by Epstein as a driver and household staff member.
Maxwell gave Alessi orders regarding picking up girls and other tasks after she arrived.
Maxwell was Epstein's associate who managed aspects of his household and social life, particularly involving young girls.
Andersson was present before Maxwell and remained friends with Epstein after she left.
Alessi thought they had a friendship but were not close, and may have hated each other.
Prince Andrew was a guest at Epstein's home, and Alessi would drive him from the airport.

events.title: Alessi's Employment and Observations
events.description: Juan Alessi describes his time working for Jeffrey Epstein, including picking up young girls, household rules, and the change in environment after Ghislaine Maxwell's arrival.

events.title: Visit by Reporter and Victim
events.description: A female reporter and a woman Alessi recognized as a former young visitor to Epstein's home spontaneously visited Alessi at his home, asking if he remembered her.

events.title: Frequent Movie Outings
events.description: Epstein, Maxwell, and others, including young women, would go to high-class movie theaters in Boca Raton and West Palm Beach approximately three times a week, often late at night.

events.title: Arrival of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Alessi marks Maxwell's arrival as the point when "everything went to hell" and younger girls came into the picture at Epstein's home.

locations: School of the Arts (school attended by a girl)
Boynton Beach Cinema (movie theater in Boca)
West Palm Beach (location of another frequented theater)
keyFacts: Juan Alessi, a former Epstein employee, states that after Ghislaine Maxwell arrived, "everything went to hell" and younger girls came into the picture.

Alessi describes strict household rules: he was not to start conversations, ask questions, talk to other staff, or let anyone sit next to him in the car. By the end, he was not allowed to look Epstein in the eyes.
Alessi recalls seeing a black costume and "all kinds of toys in a basket" in Ghislaine Maxwell's closet.
Alessi states he witnessed Epstein kissing girls on the cheek and patting them on the buttocks.
Alessi expresses relief that Epstein had died, calling him "a dangerous man."
